3G service is not available with this selected SIM. This may load data slower. You can change the 3G service setting under Settings > Wireless & networks > Mobile networks. Are you sure to select this SIM?
3G service is not available with this selected SIM. This may load data slower. You can change the 3G service setting under Settings > SIM management. Are you sure to select this SIM?

You must enable data roaming for this SIM first which may incur significant roaming charges! Besides, 3G service is not available with this SIM. This may load data slower. You can change it under Settings > Wireless & networks > Mobile networks. Are you sure to enable data roaming and select this SIM?

You must enable data roaming for this SIM first which may incur significant roaming charges! Besides, 3G service is not available with this SIM. This may load data slower. You can change it under Settings > SIM management. Are you sure to enable data roaming and select this SIM?

After enabling Auto-push service, you can receive pushed messages, incur local application running and produce data traffic. The usual auto-push services include email notification, device management, service indication, service loading and provisioning push.

Require a numeric PIN or password to decrypt your phone each time you power it on

"You can encrypt your accounts, settings, downloaded apps and their data, media, and other files. Once you encrypt your phone, you must enter a numeric PIN or password to decrypt it each time you power it on: you can't unencrypt your phone except by performing a factory data reset, erasing all your data.
Encryption takes an hour or more. You must start with a charged battery and keep your phone plugged in until encryption is complete. If you interrupt the encryption process, you will lose some or all of your data."
Charge your battery and try again.
Plug in your charger and try again.
No lock screen PIN or password
You must set a lock screen PIN or password before you can start encryption.
Encrypt phone? This operation is irreversible and if you interrupt it, you will lose data. Encryption takes an hour or more, during which the phone will restart several times.
Wait while your phone is being encrypted. ^1% complete.

"Encryption was interrupted and can't complete. As a result, the data on your phone is no longer accessible.
To resume using your phone, you must perform a factory reset. When you set up your phone after the reset, you'll have an opportunity to restore any data that was backed up to your Google Account."

"When this feature is turned on, you can beam app content to another NFC-capable device by holding the devices close together. For example, you can beam Browser pages, YouTube videos, People contacts, and more.
Just bring the devices together (typically back to back) and then touch your screen. The app determines what gets beamed."

"XP recommended. Lets you transfer files between your computer and your Android's USB storage."
WIN7 or above recommended, XP need install drivers first. Lets you manage files on phone and computer at the same time.
"Lets you transfer photos using camera software, and transfer any files on computers that don't support MTP."

This feature is for low-vision users."
%1$s can collect all of the text you type, except passwords. This includes personal data such as credit card numbers. It can also collect data about your interactions with the phone.

You can find more appropriate data usage controls in the settings available within the app."

"Your %1$s data connection will be disabled when the specified limit is reached.
Since data usage is measured by your phone, and your carrier may account for usage differently, consider using a conservative limit."

After you turn on Explore by Touch, you can touch the screen to learn whats under your finger. For example, the current screen contains app icons. Find one of them by touching the screen and sliding your finger around.
Good. Keep sliding your finger around the screen until you find at least one more icon.
To activate something that youre touching, tap it. Slide your finger until you find the icon for the %s. Then tap the icon once to activate it.
Your finger is touching the %s icon. Tap once to activate the icon.
Your finger moved over the %s icon, and then moved away. Slowly slide your finger around the screen until you find the Browser icon again.
Good. To move to the next lesson, find and activate the %s button, located near the bottom-right corner of the screen.

To scroll through a list, you can slide two fingers along the screen. For example, the current screen contains a list of app names that can scroll up or down. First, try to identify a few items in the list by sliding one finger around.
Good. Keep sliding your finger around to find at least one more item.
Now place two fingers on an item in the list and slide both fingers up. If you reach the top of the screen, lift your fingers, place them lower on the list, and continue sliding up.
Good. Keep sliding your fingers up to scroll some more.
You have completed the tutorial. To exit, find and touch the %s button.

Use GPS assistance data (EPO) to speed up GPS positioning.
It needs a wireless data connection to acquire GPS assistance data (EPO) that may cause extra network fee. Are you sure to turn on GPS assistance?

"EPO (Extended Prediction Orbit) is one of MediaTek's innovative proprietary off-line server based A-GPS technology. It supports up to 30 days satellite orbit prediction, which can be used to greatly enhance user experience by improving GPS Time To First Fix (TTFF)."

If the network under roaming condition, A-GPS data traffic may cause extra roaming fees.

"\u0009 A-GPS (Assisted-GPS) is the system that can improve the startup performance and time-to-first-fix (TTFF) of GPS satellites. \u0009 An A-GPS capable device can connect to location servers to acquire the assist data through mobile network data connection. \u0009 Notice that the data traffic may cause extra fees under network roaming conditions. Please contact with your operators for the details."

geocoder service will be used after reboot
Please read MediaTek Geocoding service use limit before using

"MediaTek Geocoding service is developed by MediaTek, based on Google Geocoding API. Namely this process will visite Google Server(http://maps.google.com/maps/api/geocode/)for result. All the Android applications can get the service by calling android default APIs. The Geocoding API may only be used in conjunction with a Google map; geocoding results without displaying them on a map is prohibited. For complete details on allowed usage, consult the Maps API Terms of Service License Restrictions. (http://code.google.com/intl/en/apis/maps/documentation/geocoding/). Use of the Google Geocoding API is subject to a query limit of 2,500 geolocation requests per day. (User of Google Maps API Premier may perform up to 100,000 requests per day.) This limit is enforced to prevent abuse and/or repurposing of the Geocoding API, and this limit may be changed in the future without notice. Additionally, Google enforce a request rate limit to prevent abuse of the service. If you exceed the 24-hour limit or otherwise abuse the service, the Geocoding API may stop working for you temporarily. If you continue to exceed this limit, your access to the Geocoding API may be blocked. You agree that you are solely responsible for (and that MediaTek has no responsibility to you or to any third party for) your noncompliance of the above conditions or obligations. You also agree to indemnify MediaTek and its affiliates for any and all losses, damages, expenses or costs arising from or relating to your breach of the above conditions or obligations set forth herein."
